intro: Eschscholzia rhombipetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is part of the Papaveraceae family. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
